title: Becarios - General Motors de México
description:
Job Description

Collaborating on innovation challenges, interacting with Industry leaders, attending cross-functional networking events and volunteering for community service activities.

Additional Job Description

Como becario en General Motors de México tendrás la oportunidad de desarrollar un proyecto relacionado a tu formación académica y/o área de interés mientras adquieres experiencia laboral dentro de la compañía automotriz más admirada de México.

Ubicaciones de nuestros centros de trabajo:

 Toluca, Estado de México Cuidad de México Silao, Guanajuato San Luis Potosí Ramos Arizpe


Requisitos:

SER UN ESTUDIANTE ACTIVO, a partir de 5to semestre o cuatrimestre de licenciatura o ingenieríaGRADUACIÓN: Verano 2025 O POSTERIOR Contar con un nivel intermedio conversacional de inglés Seguro facultativo vigente


Diversity and inclusion are our strengths. We respect and value what each individual contribution to our team, including their origin, education, sex, race, ethnic group, sexual orientation, gender expression and / or identity, religious context, age, generation, and disability. We believe that our ability to meet the needs and expectations of an increasingly diverse and global customer base is closely linked to the diversity and inclusion that we experience within General Motors.

La diversidad y la inclusión son nuestras fortalezas. Respetamos y valoramos lo que cada individuo ofrece a nuestro equipo, incluyendo su procedencia, educación, sexo, raza, grupo étnico, orientación sexual, expresión y/o identidad de género, contexto religioso, edad, generación, y discapacidad. About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

title: Quality and Field Operations Coordinator (Level 6)
description:
Job Description

La posicion es responsable apoyar la gestión de relaciones con proveedores logísticos y proveedores de servicios.

RESPONSABILIDADES

Responsable de ejecutar entregables en apoyo de los objetivos comerciales de la organización de logística. Brinda soporte de una de las áreas clave dentro de la organización de Logística y / o Contenedores para garantizar que los objetivos comerciales se cumplan o superen en todas las áreas, incluidas las iniciativas de clientes, calidad, servicio, capacidad de respuesta, personas, productos y financieras. Se comunica dentro de la función, así como otras funciones, filiales externas, agencias reguladoras. Responsable de apoyar la gestión de relaciones con proveedores logísticos y proveedores de servicios. Influye en otros dentro de la organización para que acepten nuevos conceptos, prácticas y enfoques. Identificar problemas, actualizar o modificar métodos de trabajo que pueden ser complejos en el área de trabajo sin el beneficio de los procedimientos definidos. Promueve los valores de GM y toma decisiones centradas en el cliente.


Eliminando obstáculos y resolviendo problemas / quejas: Observa y avanza para eliminar obstáculos y resolver posibles problemas.

Additional Job Description

The Quality and Field Operation coordinator is responsible of assuring that all the units are delivered with zero defects during transportation to the final customer, this includes vandalism and damages that occurs either by the yard/port manager or carries that include Rail, Haulaway and Vessel or Ocean carriers.

This include not only the follow up of supplier performances but also this role is responsible to find root cause of the damages and work with suppliers to assure implementation of action plans to mitigate the condition.

This role support GM Quality (central quality and plant quality) to coordinate that all the quality campaigns inspections that apply for vehicles in Mexico take place and vehicles are shipped according the standard defined and/or required.

Responsible to lead the repair process and the repair supplier at all GM sites providing continuous feedback, solving roadblocks and measure their performance.

Also, this position is accountable to coordinate the up fitted process performed by the suppliers at the VDCs or any other location designated for this activity.

Work as a team with CCA department on the supply of parts for vehicles required assuring that all restrictions or roadblocks are removed to successfully get parts on time.

This role is accountable to provide feedback to VSSM team in regards of the status and vehicles that are not saleable due to a damage or quality campaign as well as work together with them to define priorities.

This role is accountable for the performances of supplier on GM sites in terms of Quality and Safety during field operations.

title: Dimensional Engineer N6
description:
Job Description

Job Description:

Coordinates work share with other regional partners relative to creation and development of dimensional reports using Siemens Dimensional Planning & Validation (DPV) software. These reports are utilized to present data information for CMM, vision, handheld, and scanning inspection routines in a user-friendly manner and posted in the Global Dimensional Information System (GDIS) to support dimensional activities during launch of new vehicle programs and steady state.

Monitor manufacturing dimensional data flow for plants assigned closely, troubleshoot and resolve data flow issues in a timely manner. Works closely with Launch team, Plant personnel, and suppliers to ensure timely completion of projects.

Monitor, prioritize and respond to Plant Requests for updates, corrections, maintenance issues, new data flow routines & create reports for the web.

Partners with technical customers to support analysis of data and solve issues.

Provides technical assistance and training to use DPV software/analysis tools, GDIS, and General Motors business process and standards for flowing dimensional data and creation of various standard web based dimensional reports.

Actively support the teams improvement of business tools and processes related to DPV and business processes to support dimensional data flow and report creation.

Support global Teamcenter and DPV software testing events (Coordination with IT, Development) including, but not limited to, defining the scope, develop and write test cases for an international audience.

Develop SME skillset in Siemens DPV Reporting and Analysis toolset (Teamcenter DPV concepts, Factorylink, SSRS, TCC).

description:
Job Description

What you will do?

In this role, you will manage the maintenance and repair of plant equipment and facilities aligned with standard GM maintenance systems in addition to the following responsibilities:

 You will conduct appropriate checks and tests, and communicate evaluation of results Recommends solutions to problems Responsible for preventative maintenance and diagnosis of equipment malfunctions Meets schedule and quality requirements Complies with the terms of local and national labor agreements Implements divisional and corporate policies and safety and good housekeeping practices Maintain frequent contact and collaboration in other areas outside of working group Responsible for the effective use of personnel, material and equipment Establishes a course of action to accomplish completion of the job and/or project. Has knowledge and ability to implement GMS principles


Maintain the backups updated of the electronic equipment using UDC system.

Inventory of the controls diagnostic equipment, tools and software.Continuous development of technical skill according to the versatility chart , technical training.Maintain and trouble shooting of the manufacturing system functionality ( PMC , ANDON , FLEXNET ).Generate technical reports of trouble shooting process and improvements implemented.Attend meetings and follow up: TIP continuous improvement, teamwork, manufacturing systems, safety.


Work Appropriately

On Site: This position requires to work on site on a full-time basis

Additional Job Description

Required Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s Degree: Mechatronic, Mechanical, Electrical Engineer and all Engineering related.Required experience in similar position: from 3 to 5 years.Available to change shifts (4x3, 5x2, 6x1).English Level: Advanced.


Key Skills: 

Preferred Qualifications:

Interpretation of Electrical drawings.

Electrical specifications and standards.

Siemens S7 PLC Programming, trouble shooting.

Siemens 840D Solution Line Programming, trouble shooting.

Siemens HMI configuration.

Networks Profibus, Profinet , Ethernet communication and configuration.

Fanuc Robot Programming, trouble shooting.

Vision systems: Cameras, Scanners.

Remember to attach your CV when applying to this vacancy.
